field.label: Asn1 Max Frames
field.help: Limit for max number of asn1 frames to decode. Default is 256 frames. To protect itself, Suricata will inspect only the maximum asn1 frames specified. Application layer protocols such as X.400 electronic mail, X.500 and LDAP directory services, H.323 (VoIP), and SNMP, use ASN.1 to describe the protocol data units (PDUs) they exchange.

field.label: UDP Parser
field.help: Selecting "yes" enables detection and parser, "no" disables both and "detection-only" disables parser.

field.label: TCP Parser
field.help: Selecting "yes" enables detection and parser, "no" disables both and "detection-only" disables parser.

field.label: UDP Detection Port
field.help: Enter comma-separated list (or a Port alias) of ports for the DNS UDP parser. Default is 53.

field.label: TCP Detection Port
field.help: Enter comma-separated list (or a Port alias) of ports for the DNS TCP parser. Default is 53.

field.label: Global Memcap
field.help: Sets the global memcap limit for the DNS parser. Default is 16777216 bytes (16MB).

field.label: Flow/State Memcap
field.help: Sets per flow/state memcap limit for the DNS parser. Default is 524288 bytes (512KB).

field.label: Request Flood Limit
field.help: How many unreplied DNS requests are considered a flood. Default is 500 requests. If this limit is reached, 'app-layer-event:dns.flooded' will match and alert.

field.label: SMTP Parser
field.help: Choose the parser/detection setting for SMTP. Default is yes. Selecting "yes" enables detection and parser, "no" disables both and "detection-only" disables parser.

field.label: Enable MIME Decoding
field.help: Suricata will decode MIME messages from SMTP transactions. Note this may be resource intensive!

field.label: Base64 MIME Decoding
field.help: Suricata will decode Base64 MIME entity bodies.

field.label: Quoted-Printable MIME Decoding
field.help: Suricata will decode quoted-printable MIME entity bodies.

field.label: MIME URL Extraction
field.help: Suricata will Extract URLs and save in state data structure.

field.label: MIME Body MD5 Calculation
field.help: Suricata will compute the md5 of the mail body so it can be journalized.

field.label: TLS Parser
field.help: Choose the parser/detection setting for TLS. Default is yes. Selecting "yes" enables detection and parser, "no" disables both and "detection-only" disables parser.

field.label: Detection Ports
field.help: Enter a comma-separated list of ports (or port alias) to examine for TLS traffic (e.g., 443, 8443). Default is 443.

field.label: Encryption Handling
field.help: What to do when the encrypted communications start. "Default" keeps tracking the TLS session to check for protocol anomalies and inspect tls_* keywords; "Bypass" stops processing this flow as much as possible; and "Full" keeps tracking and inspection as normal including unmodified content keyword signatures. For best performance, select "Bypass".

field.label: JA3/JA3S Fingerprint
field.help: Suricata will generate JA3/JA3S fingerprint from client hello. Default is Not Checked, which disables fingerprinting unless required by the rules.
